TopicTitle: Video Wednesdays: KSP Mech for Jeb

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/87dda5f22121633ebc5ff4dc817129a6/tumblr_inline_ncfmuyZUEX1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/l7f9ut9ueHg" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p>Daz050571 may have quite possibly made the closest thing to Kerbal ballet that you’re going to see. This video’s a beauty and we hope you’ll like it.</p>
I am totally impressed! The "Parlor Music" Just took it over the top for me. I'm an old "Mech Warrior", and , well, nuff said. Absolutely awesome.

Yep, ballet with rockets and robot, what else can you expect from Jeb?

Nicely done!

Ohhhh. Mech FOR Jeb. Now I get it.

I thought it said MechJeb I was thinking Squad had lost their minds and just started posting random videos of mechjeb.

Edited September 25, 2014 by Alshain
Wow, that's amazing. The rockets that it shot out of its hands and legs were hilarious though.
I was just watching this on YouTube! Awesome having a horde of KSP YouTubers to fill my feed with the latest and greatest of Kerbal engineering . And I haven't seen those actuators before. Very cool.
Just wow, I want one
I really didn't expect to find this here, thanks for the comments and thanks Squad for featuring it

So that's what a Kerbal looks like with a body roughly proportional to his head...

Really impressed by the hand stand...and did I see a target hit by that rocket fired from the hand stand position? Nifty trick.

Also impressed by the smooth walking. I would have expected something more QWOP-ish.
If this doesn't convince Squad we'd love to see stock rotary parts, at least to be able to make Canadarms, I don't know what will.

I was just watching this on YouTube! Awesome having a horde of KSP YouTubers to fill my feed with the latest and greatest of Kerbal engineering . And I haven't seen those actuators before. Very cool.

The moving parts are likely from the Infernal Robotics mod.
I take it that's Darren9's youtube channel?

I take it that's Darren9's youtube channel?
It is my usually quite little corner of YouTube that's seeing some unexpected activity. I thought just the usual few from the Infernal Robotics threads would be interested, I would of tidied the place up a bit and maybe put some categories and descriptions if I'd known people would be dropping by
I updated this to a more complete and better edited version if anyone is interested, has the trip to Minmus and Kerbcam/Baha cameras.
